Posts.Content: l went to the fab 'Feel Good' afternoon at Maggies (Clatterbridge, Wirral, Chesh.)  And l met an interesting lady. We chatted about Taxotere....then she mentioned about going to Nepal, China etc as a fundraising trip with Macmillan.  l would absolutely love to do something like that.  My Chemo ends Dec 8th, then surgery prob Jan, then l imagine Radio after that.  So l'm sure l cant  think about doing  anything until later  next year.  But l'd love to be thinking about it.  A diversion of mind can only be a good thing as l tread the b c boards on a daily basis for months ahead.  l wondered if there were any trips that l could do that arnt Sports natured   ie  Volunteering in  a Cancer centre  in Vietnam...for example.    if there isnt, l'd be happy to plan it myself and still fundraise...but think probably going under the Umbrella of the cancer Charity (ie Macmillan)  would be better for the insurance cover and pos better than doing it solo.    A lot to think about, but God, l'd love to do it (and fund raise as much as pos for breast cancer/cancer).
Posts.Title: A Fundraising Trip abroad After Treatment ?

Posts.Content: Hi JackiRuss,   After reading your post,  l mean this compassionately, but it seems the chemo treatement is getting in the way of you trying to live your normal life ie carry on working as lf youve just had a tooth out.  You l presume have  a cancerous tumor.  l'm not a medic, l've just completed 5/8 Chemo's...but  l treat my illness v v seriously.  l listen very carefully to the hospital's advise.   Job wise,  l am  my mum dads Carer, and 3 wks before l had this bc diagnoses, l moved in to live with them for for forseeable. l also am a landlord with the work that involves.  But as soon as l was diagnosed, l made an instant effort to shrink down my work load as much as possible. So l could give this serious diagnoses my best shot !      Now the mornings are ''my time'' so l can sleep, rest, etc.  Then l do an hour making mum dads lunch, then rest /sleep or go out and do what l want.  l've off loaded my house cleaning for the houses etc.  You must think on these lines, and treat your illness seriously.   if you feel it's a money worry, speak to work,  l'm a bit out of touch re working for someone, but surely in this day and age, working in a job with cancer surely having time off during this serious time in your life is do- able.     ln the past, l've had times where l've had to seriously  trim down my spending...and  it can be a fun challenge to do, and rewarding to achieve.   Please dont think light of your bc illness.  You must put it top of your list of priorities !  Let us know.  Hugs, xx
Posts.Title: First chemo was on 17th August

Posts.Content: JackiRuss,  You must do some serious tweaking to daily life.  You have a serious illness (no one else in your daily life has)  Sort out re time off for now)  Your daughter with the baby will cope. Sit your 10 yr old down and explain...that you will do all you can...but its a tricky time with all the chemo's happening...explain about how the chemo carries on working on  your body when you are at home in between each chemo..tell her she will need to help you and maybe when she comes home from school...sh might need to peel a few potoatoes..go to the shop for more milk..or pick fish and chips for tea..so the meal times are more a shared thing (instead of you doing everything)    She can wash up, thn leave the dishes to dry themselves.   She can help by putting some washing in the machine before sh goes to school (why not)   l'm not a Mum..so there will be Mum's on here who can offer you better advise 'm sure (me more a doggy adviser !)    Sat morning, she can run the hoover over and do few more lil jobs.  All l imagine well within a 10 yr olds capacity)    l'm a deligater in business, so l'm used to planning others to share the work load.    l've found Waitrose a brill online shop brought to the home..great for heavy stuff like bleach, tinned stuff, loo rolls, frozen chips/fab fab Creamed Rice Pud with clotted cream (dont just buy one)  etc.  Then that order stays on your a/c so next time you go online, its easy to re order those things you want again. And as YOU WILL BE OFF WORK...the staying in for the delivery is easy.   Sort work out first.  Sorry to nag...hope this helps. hugs xx
Posts.Title: First chemo was on 17th August

Posts.Content: jane h.  Absolutely only start back running slowly and surely.  Packed up my sport (badminton) years ago, but its still the same old advise.  Also, l'd be inclined to have a rethink re a different way of getting fit again...pos swimming /walking...and a good one...walk/jog/walk/jog to build up.   l'm on day 3 of the darling Taxotere ...so l'm bracing myself for tomorrow (day 4)  to see how l cope.   Any advise gratefully received.  Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Exercising after treatment

Posts.Content: Oh God Little Wombat !    All that would def freak me out aswell.   l was only thinking this week what a niggly snappy person l am these days.  l'm glad l live alone so l dont have problems like yours.  How did they react to your home truths ?  You should be treated like a lord ! l'm being serious !  Where abouts do you live ?  (youre going to say Aus !!!)   send me your address and l would be delighted to send you a box of Toffifees   i'd be sad if you dont !!      lf you can pm me or whatever.  l'm going to try and follow what Carolyn28 said to do...but me feeling soo ropy as l type, it might take me a bit x
Posts.Title: Why ?

Posts.Content: Hi french and  gem.  l'm not one of the experts on here who offer fab comforting advise...lm just lil ol' me who had bc diagnosed late April. l believe lm getting first class treatment between Linda MacCartney bc wing (Royal LPool) and Clatterbridge.  And this amazing website, l dont think l could be better looked after !  Yes its a scary road, where we can flit from being ok and in control with what's happening ....to throw ourselves in panic mode and feel we need answers to our worry of the moment  immediately.  l seem to remember the Chemo Specialist recom. a few bc support sites, and l think l joined one (..forgotton...chemo brain !)  But this site is so important  to me.  My morning treat (l'm lucky l can allow myself to chill in bed til midday)  So my 2 lil treats are seeing what my fb are up to..clicking on their hol photos...oh god l wish it was me !  And coming on this here to read the new posts and catch up, and as my treatment is going well, and lm feeling very positive and (oddly) upbeat, l can now feel l can reply to newbies starting down the same road we've all started on.  l might not be up there with the expert advise the likes of dreamthief/lacomtekp/gem1981/french/caroline28..and soo may more...but if l we others can chip in and support - well it can only help.  Love from Carol in windy Wirral !  xx
Posts.Title: I have just been diagnosed with invasive ductual carcinoma stage 2...

Posts.Content: Hi KiwiCardi,  l agree, l drink soo much more from a water bottle.  l buy the 6 x pack of small water bottles from my Tesco Express ( approx 1 pound)  l asked my Chemo nurse re drinking more thro the Chemo's. But she said no, just drink your normal amount that you drink.  l was also worried that drinking more water might weaken the Chemo that was going in...but that might be a bonkers thought !   l'm finding buying smoothies or similar are great.  l'm getting the contents plus the liquid.  My absolute favourite is the Innocent 'Totally Tropical'' (Pineapple, Banana & Coconut..colour of  weetabix)  omg...l'd drank the whole bottle driving home from Asda ! They hit the spot on all counts...dont give me hearburn or indigestion.... easy to drink..and stay down ! xx
Posts.Title: Struggling to drink recommended fluids after chemotherapy!

Posts.Content: Hi Lakeslover,  Quick question, is there a simple way l can refresh my post l put up yesterday.  lt disappeared instantly down the  page .  l'm used to a quick 'share' on fb, so its easy to bring it to top of the page (cant do 'copy and paste..with my chemo head)  Thnx   Post was ''Just when ...    Thnx
Posts.Title: Back Pain Post Radio?

Posts.Content: fiddlesticks,  ls it a pos to buy what you like and remove the wire ?  l havnt had surgery yet, but l did have massive bruising after my 6 Core Biopsies, but l carried on wearing my super soft (wired ) bra.  Not sure how to post up photo's on here, but happy to email you the photo of the bra l have (M and S)   vanillacph@gmail.com   Carol x
Posts.Title: Bras - rant!!!!

Posts.Content: bougicat.  l havnt had surgery yet, (but did have 6 v painful and bruised core biopsies)  l wear my favourite M and S v v soft underwired bra. if l wanted non wire - but pretty colours etc, why not consider taking out the wire. it probably with a lil cut, just slide out. Then put it back in, when youre able to wear the underwire bra again !   Just a thought.  Love Carol xx  My Chemo friend (Jeanie B  on here aswell)  buys suitable bra's from Asda and loves them !
Posts.Title: Bras - rant!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi hedgewitch, Dont you mean....Has the soak away had an effect on your Chemo.  Or my question might be...has the soak away contributed to you getting c.  Best Wishes.
Posts.Title: Septic tank & effect of chemo on it .... random but ....

Posts.Content: Rach1969.  Think of having a PICC Line in...like having a TV remote - apposed to...getting up to change the channel every time  (like we used to ! )   Happy Days !  Carol x
Posts.Title: Picc line for chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Rach1969.  lf you want my advise, just have it fitted.  The specialist PICC Line male nurse (nurse ?)  was brilliant.  He was excellent.   l prefer having a bath with the PICC Line arm, so l can wallow in the bath with my arm resting on the side of the bath.  lt needs to be kept dry, so for me, a bath is a nice slow soak, rather than the showering system.  But maybe others can manage easily.  l'm a bath lover anyway. Carol x
Posts.Title: Picc line for chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Rach1969.   Definately go for the PICC Line.  l remembered going thro hell  trying to find a vein, when l had my 8 IVF's donkeys years ago.  And it all came back to me at the start of this b/c lark in April/May.  The blood nurse at Clatterbridge suggested it, and its been v v good to have in.  The District Nurse comes every week to dress/flush it.  Except the week l'm having Chemo (then the hosp does it the day before when l have my bloods done ready for the darling Chemo next day.   For me, l find having a bath easier to keep it dry, than a shower.   Ask me anything l've missed here Rach.  Carol x
Posts.Title: Picc line for chemo

Posts.Content: l've gone from one extreme to the other.  Kept bragging on, '' l've sailed thro my 4 x EC.''     But now on Taxotere (started last Thurs) and boy has it hit me !   l'm now spending virtually all the time time in bed with exactly the side effects l was warned about (aching bones/muscles. ..blood when l blow nose...and v unpleasant hard snot (medical word ??)  that is soo painful to remove.....taste buds shot at...struggling to walk from bed to toilet.... bowels  movements all over the place, and generally feeling v poorly.  My question is this.  l want to buy something l can sit on in bed...something better than a pillow under my bottom.     l  want to feel more comfortable propped up in my bed for all these waking hours,   ( like l'm sitting on a bean bag leaning back on the pillows, but something firmer than the beans)    Just wondered if anyone has bought something that's good.
Posts.Title: Advise re being more comfortable propped up in bed !

Posts.Content: Swampy 1901,  Thnx.  l've got the V Pillow   (and lots of pillows) But would love something to plonk my bottom on, and feel really secure and cosy (l dont find a pillow under my bottom enough)  Hugs, xx
Posts.Title: Advise re being more comfortable propped up in bed !

Posts.Content: Thnx Lakomtekp (Karen)   l'm having 6 x months Chemo, then surgery.  Started June 2nd 4 x EC. (completed that)  Just had 1/4 x Taxotere.  Cant imagine all these s/e disappearing overnight..so l've got to grin and bare it.  Never watched soo much telly in all my life !   lol    Missing catching up with my friends in the pub...but grateful for fb and this  massively comforting site !   xx
Posts.Title: Advise re being more comfortable propped up in bed !

Posts.Content: Thnx Lancomtekp,   l know we're constantly told..''we're  all different''  But l imagined it would last bit beyond my last chemo (3 months)    So, 6 wks, is better.  Thanks again, hugs,xx
Posts.Title: Advise re being more comfortable propped up in bed !

Posts.Content: Thnx to Dreamthief  and Everyone who replied.  Yes l was given the injections nightly (did them myself )  Glad l probs wont have an extra one.  Next on my 'worry list'  is Tuesday having bone scan at The Royal Lpool. Had a MRI scan at Chester, and they said  ''it hasnt gone anywhere else at this stage''.   But then my Oncologist (and then ''the team'' )  spotted something. on the Xray.    Extremely unusual for me, l didnt even ask about the details.  But l will on tuesday.  Then, its Taxotere 2/4 on Thursday.  Happy Days ! x   ps  Marine20   Very brave cancelling your Taxotere.  What is the alternative ? And what did your Onc. say ?
Posts.Title: Oh Boy ! Fell At The First Taxotere Hurdle !!

Posts.Content: l am having 10 x Chemo's  every 3 wks ( 5 x EC  5 X Taxotere)   l've just had 3/10 and think lve more or sailed  thro them (only some tiredness..and of course the hair loss)   l'm v wary the Taxotere might (will ?) be a different ball game, but would love to go on a mini cruise sometime in between chemo's before the Taxotere starts.  lm aware Insurance might be wacked up, but also wondered about not bothering with it (if its a problem) and just find an a and e or fly back same day if l had to.  To get away and do this, would be an enormous tonic for me at this time.  Has anyone done anything like this ?  Thnx Carol
Posts.Title: Any advise re a mini cruise (GB)

Posts.Content: Hi Lakeslover.  l have no intention of going abroad. The title of my post is Mini cruise GB.  And would probably drive.  Thnx anyway.  Carol
Posts.Title: Any advise re a mini cruise (GB)

Posts.Content: Flopsy Lynda, isnt it !  lve stayed at Sawrey House hotel a few times...perfectly positioned for the lovely Tower Banks pub.  l love the lil car ferry, and every time l've been its been idylic balmy weather. l love to head off to the small town (chemo brain forgets name) where lm a magnet for Lakeland Plastics ...where l often buy another baking tin l dont need !  x
Posts.Title: Any advise re a mini cruise (GB)

Posts.Content: Arrhh Karen (Your user name Lapcomtekp ,is a tricky one to remember) Thats soo exciting for you. How has  being treated in France been ?   l lived in Spain for 15 years (been back 6) and the hosps were v v good (Denia, Costa Blanca) Mind you, l didnt have b c then.  Maybe l should stay on the ground in a nice Hotel (near an a and e...just incase)  l think im probably just wanting what l cant have at the moment..to fly abroad.  l was in my local the other warm evening down at Eastham Woods (overlooking the River Mersey looking up river to the Liverbirds building and Speke Airport, and l pointed up to a plane above my head....''l want to be on that plane !!''    ''No you dont'' they said, ''Oh yes l do''  ''No Carol you dont its going to Speke !!''  Ha ha !  Have as much enjoyment planning your trip to Italy.  Are you familiar with Alistair Sawdey's books on special places to stay ?  l love them. l know he has an Alistair Sawdey's Italy book. l have the India one, and l literally read it page to page like a book. Even if you have your accom planned, it gives you soo much info about the tucked away villages and towns that the places to stay offer. Ciao, Carol
Posts.Title: Any advise re a mini cruise (GB)

Posts.Content: NonnyMouse.  5 wks exactly from initial private diagnoses to first NHS Chemo. The delay was because l had to have 3 more Core Biopsies..and then they sent those to America for results.  l was seen each week for updates and whatever the Oncologist needed (ie more core biopsies etc)   6 months Chemo, then surgery. Carol
Posts.Title: Question re Breast Cancer chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Flopsyuk, Thnx very much for your info. Yes, l do the injections day 3 for 7 days.  Not bothered re table or buffet service during the day , but def want something more upmarket than queuing up for dinner at might. Considering l only eat a few yogurts per day normally, l can easily handle ordering something suitable at night. Never felt sea sick on car ferries.  l will def enquire re Norovirus.  Soo many thanks Flopsy...funnily enough, l've just looked at staying up in Sawrey Sun/Mon nights...next to Flopsy, Mopsy and Cottontail's farm (Hilltop, Sawrey')   CAROL X
Posts.Title: Any advise re a mini cruise (GB)

Posts.Content: 4 x EC   (easy peasy!)    1/4 x Taxotere and l'v just spent  7 days in hospital.  lt was bang on as they said it might  be, Day 4 and l felt exactly ....flu like symptoms, plus feeling soo unwell.  Day 4 / Day 5 / Day 6  felt dreadful every min.  .  Temps spiking at 37.9..then dropping , then rising to 37.9  then dropping.  l rang Triage at midnight Tuesday  and they asked me lots of questions, then told me to go straight in.  So glad l did, because they said my White Cells were 0,01 (?)   And whilst they said l'd done the right thing to alert Triage, l should have actually rang them sooner.   l havnt posted this to frighten anyone, but more to praps be a bit of a warning, not to let your temps keep spiking so high in the hopes it'll come down and stay down.   Like probably most of us on here, we dont want to mither Triage without a genuine reason.  But they all said ''You must ring us sooner if anything like this happens again'' !!    They are reducing my Taxotere by 25% for the 2nd one next Thursday.   Not sure if that means they'll add a 5th one on the end, l'm not sure.  Had fantastic care in Clatterbridge.  They were brilliant !
Posts.Title: Oh Boy ! Fell At The First Taxotere Hurdle !!

Posts.Content: Thnx Kacang  (Lynne)  You are spot on...inc  your middle piece re ...dont stress out over every lil blot on the xray landscape !  My Oncologist at Clatterbridge/Lpool said , patients so often ask me, why arnt l having lots of scans/Xrays, and she said, putting it all in the melting pot, we think its better to not go mad doing soo many scans etc, because often lots of lil areas show up as pos concerns, and more often than not, they turn out to be nothing....but the poor patient goes thro so much stress worrying/waiting for results, that it isnt good to do too much in a short space of time.   So it relaxed me a bit re my own bone scan at The Royal Lpool on Tues.  Love to everyone xx
Posts.Title: Oh Boy ! Fell At The First Taxotere Hurdle !!

Posts.Content: Thnx Crystaljuju and all who made good points re Taxotere.  l seem to be sailing thro the EC, so l will head forward with the Taxotere.  l think l panicked when l read that someone's lump had grown( plus pain) after Taxo.  Plus it being known as The Work Of The Devil.  But l'l normally very laid back, so l'll just wait for my first Taxo 15 Sept.
Posts.Title: Taxotere.........please stop panicking!

Posts.Content: Hi flopsyuk.  l was asking the Chemo Sister about Taxo (as l call it) yesterday, and she said main side effect is flu like pains.  But she said, whilst everyone is different, the fact that l've sailed thro the EC''s, she thinks l might b ok on Taxo.   For some reason, l got my number of Chemo's wrong. l'm only having 4 x EC (HAD 4TH yesterday)  So start Taxo in 3 wks (25th)  Another bit of good news, l know my lump has shrunk, but when l mentioned that l could feel the metal pin that they put in next to where the lump was)  Chemo Sister said that is a sign that your lump has shrunk.  Me oddly elated !!   All l want is a body scan, to see if its gone anywhere else !  xx
Posts.Title: Taxotere.........please stop panicking!

Posts.Content: LookitsMeg.   Raising money for breast cancer/cancer is fantastic, and l do, and will carry on.    But shaving your head in support, turns having a shaved head because lwe have breast cancer...turns the  former into a unpleasant farce , and it hurts (not ''annoyed'')  soo many' people who are going thro the  same worse than drradful v scary illness.       But like you make a point of saying..  ''l dont care for one minute if people are annoyed   by that.''     You will do it regardless !       Judy58  Wholly agree with you ! x
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: If this brilliant website could form some sort of  2 boxes...One to tick for AGAINST 'Brave The Shave' and One to tick FOR 'Brave The Shave'  This would give a very clear picture of  how much/little everyone on here feels about this offending  (in my opinion) ad Macmillan have created.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi Kacang....ls this my bc buddy awake at silly o'clock like me ?  I'm having 3/4 Taxo on Thurs, and apart from l look dreadful (puffed up eyes...look 20 yrs older!)  My only suffering is quit unbearable heartburn. Normally milk is my saviour (and Esomeprazole l take for a reflux thing)  But neither are helping. l'll ask my chemo nurse on Thurs.   Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: l have tried to google this Brave The Shave Ad...but cant see anything.  Does anyone know where l can see it ?  Thnx xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Thnx Dreamthief for the link.  No, l def dont like it.    Nor would l have liked it before l lost my hair to breast cancer.  There is nothing fun, smiley or ''lets do it together' for our poorly friend '' ...about losing your hair due to the severe drugs we have to endure in order to possibly keep alive.   This fund raising campaign hasnt been thought out compassionately for everyone involved.   (in my humble opinion)  xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Flopsyuk, l'm not sure what you mean.  Are you agreeing with the ad, and therefore like it regularly appearing on your webpages.  Or you dont like it appearing reg. on your webpages ? (me, l find it offensive!)   xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: l just dont like the Brave The Shave thing at all.      Which woman would want to face seeing their bare scalp every day...and then see her friends with the same shaved head.   l know l absolutely dont !  l want to see my friends looking healthy and smiley, and know that's gonna be me when l get thro this and come thro the other end !        l dont want my friends who are healthy and cancer free looking like  l do at the moment.       l just  want  get on with the job of concentrating on getting thro our seriously important treatment plan, and embrace the  day our head of hair comes back and lets us move on and be normal again.      Love to everyone xx
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: l started my Chemo June '16  Not sure if l'm on the most up to date forum re Breast Cancer posts ?  l am just about to have my 3rd Chemo (every 3 wks for 6 months)  l think mine has gone ok. Only tiredness..and of course my lovely hair has gone ! But still have my eyebrows/eyelashes    l'm happily surviving daily on ....3 Muller Light Yogs.... 2 x shots of Floradix (an old fashioned Iron/Vit tonic) ... 1 or 2 Vodka/coke (evening) 1 pkt Fruit gums  1x Multigrain Ryvita/butter/Cheese. Tea and plenty of water.   l'm having 5 x EC.  Then 5 x Docetaxel (Taxotere)... The Taxo one, l've been told to dread !  l'm a realist, so would welcome anyone's experiences with this monkey !!
Posts.Title: This is the best BC forum!

Posts.Content: Hi Ange, Infections are a v big concern during Chemo. So why risk and put yourself at peril and the hospitals   unnecessarily possibly having to take time to treat you.
Posts.Title: real tattoos

Posts.Content: for two days now, my right eye is sooo painful !  l wonder if anyone else has had the same thing.     lt seems to be inside my eyelid.  The eyelid is red and swollen and inside the top eyelid is also red.  (The other eye is normal and flesh coloured)   The district Nurse is coming tomorrow to dress/flush my PICC line, so l might see what she says. Feels like my eyeball has been microwaved  (cooked from the inside !)  This is my first side effect problem since starting June 2nd !  Carol x
Posts.Title: ...Just when l thought l am sailing thro my 3/5 EC.

Posts.Content: Oh Carolyn 28..Thanx soo much for your ace advise !  l'll limp along for tonight..and do a Yorkshire tea bag treatment if desp.  l will send you an imaginary cake..whatever you fancy (lol)  This website blows me away !   Hugs to everyone !   Carol xx
Posts.Title: ...Just when l thought l am sailing thro my 3/5 EC.

Posts.Content: Kitkat59 (Gillian)    l can pm you all the gory progress as it happens !   But dont think this site does pm like fb.  l've been taking Floradix liq iron/vitamin tonic since l started the chemo's.  At my first chemo, a lady who was having her last one, said that whilst she wouldnt know, she liked to think the Floradix was the reason why her bloods were always spot of for each chemo.  Cant do any harm, so l take it religously !    (vanillacph@gmail.com)    Carol   Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Kitkat59.   No, the Taxotere s/e didntkick in until day 4 (like they said)  So since June 2nd...this is only  my second bad day in total.  Keep on trucking.  And remember - No pain - No gain !  Hugs x
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: kitkat59   ls this EC you're on ?  Or Taxotere ?    l've done 4 x EC, and sailed thro them with virtually no side effects.  But yesterday was day 4 of Taxotere, and omg l felt soo unwell.  l'm bracing myself for day 5 (today)    Aching flu like symtoms (like they warned)     l'm a realist, so any advise is welcome.  Feels lik my nails are going to drop off !    l'll be staying in bed all day me thinks, and get day 5 out the way asap ! x   Wondering if this is the worst, or the start.
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Portacath in their arm? The one under the skin?

Posts.Content: Marine20  Funny that, My  Chemo consultant said that ..Now you have finished EC , your hair will start to grow back. But when you start Taxotere you will lose any remaining eye lashes and eyebrows. Also you'll probably get flu like aches, and nail problems.  Your first one will be the worst one, but as you've sailed thro 4 x EC, hopefully your body will handle Taxotere easier than some do.   l start Taxotere 10am tomorrow !  Grhhhhhh   xxx
Posts.Title: eyebrows, eyelashes and lizard feet

Posts.Content: Carolyn 28  Thnx a million ! xx
Posts.Title: Chemo's finished !!

Posts.Content: Thnx Carolyn,  Where do l get a  Yellow Chemo Card from ?  (not heard of those )  x
Posts.Title: Chemo's finished !!

Posts.Content: Hi Jazmine .  l put a fresh post on the travel section, but it hasnt shown in the blogs as a new post. l must have done something wrong ?  Just wanted to know if anyone recommended an up to date travel insurance company (l'm hoping to go on a cruise Xmas 2016)  Many thnx, Always Baking (Carol)
Posts.Title: Anyone recommend a . good travel insurance comp after chemo's ?

Posts.Content: Just had 2/4 of the darling Taxotere (yesterday)  So finish October 27th.  All being well..... l'm looking to go away Xmas/New Year.     lf l went to Spain    ( where i uses to live 15yrs Moraira, Costa Blanca, )...thinking if took ill, and needed a hosp, l'd go to Denia Hosp or fly home, so would only take out insurance if it was a reasonable price)  But l fancy a v good cruise.    So insurance would be important.  l've looked at Cunard.      l am with my bank insurance for international cover.  l havnt told  them or any insurance company re my bc...as l dont know best way to seek cover (without it opening up an  expensive can of worms at this stage)   l'd be very interested in knowing of people's experience of the travel insurance companies recommended (and the ones to avoid !)   Thnx in advance !
Posts.Title: Anyone recommend a . good travel insurance comp after chemo's ?

Posts.Content: Thnx Jazmine,  l wonder how l can move my post  question onto the 'travel ins blog' page (without me re typing it)  Specially as last posts were 2014..so think l need fresh info.  Thnx Jaz.
Posts.Title: Anyone recommend a . good travel insurance comp after chemo's ?

Posts.Content: So glad l'm saying this ..... 6 months Chemo's are now behind me.  Had last one on Thursday, and the staff clapped me out, and l emotionally rang that bell !   Surgery will l presume be new year (but the scan will b interesting as neither me nor my olcologist can feel the malteser that was there in April when finding it raised the alarm ! )    lt's a bit too early after my last Chemo, but its the only chance l've got to have few days away...so l'm off the Ireland for few days. next Thurs.    The hosp have advised m re face mask for flights and asprin  for 3 days around flights both ways etc.  But wondered if l could pos get a disabled pass l can stick on my hire car for when l'm there (incase l'm feling wobbly if l cant partk near where l want to be)   l go on Thurs, so havnt got time to apply for proper disabled badge (and dont want one)  Just a temp thing for next week and  Xmas hire car Invernss - Skye.  Wondered if my GP could help with something.  Any advise would be really helpful  xx
Posts.Title: Chemo's finished !!

Posts.Content: Thnx again Jaz, l'll look again.  Def havnt the brain at mo to learn how to copy/paste. But thnx anyway. xx
Posts.Title: Anyone recommend a . good travel insurance comp after chemo's ?

Posts.Content: Hi Jazmine .  l put a fresh post on the travel section, but it hasnt shown in the blogs as a new post. l must have done something wrong ?  Just wanted to know if anyone recommended an up to date travel insurance company (l'm hoping to go on a cruise Xmas 2016)  Many thnx,
Posts.Title: Anyone recommend a . good travel insurance comp after chemo's ?

Posts.Content: Flopsyuk,  You are a Guardian Angel !   Always the perfect replies to sooth the soul and comfort when its needed on here.   l'm quite envious when l notice loving husbands/partners being such a support...but then l read sad posts like  PJ's, and think maybe its not too  bad coping with bc on my own.  (had long marriage)       No one to pressurise me specially with all this going on.  PJ. ... Do what you feel is best for you and your recovery Pj.   Hugs xx
Posts.Title: How to tell my husband

Posts.Content: Hi Louby 123.  My last Chemo is on Thursday (4 x EC  4 X Taxotere)   Try and buy sugar free sweets/mints.  Having said that, Rountrees Fruit Gums are brill for a fruit taste burst.  l havnt suffered with any mouth problems, but l know Bicarb is v good. (Bicarb apart from an essential for baking...is my wonder ingredient for burns.    l've never been sick or felt sick throughout my 6 months...so cant advise you re that.  Nor have l had a sore mouth.  Only some tiredness during early stages of EC.    Funnily l asked at my Chemo re drinking more water, and she said, no, just drink as you do.  After the EC, and during my Taxotere, my hair has started to grow back.  l went to pick up my 3rd wig in Penny Lane, LPool, and the hairdresser/wig specialist told me to shave off my new fury growth, and start again..so l will !  Sorry l havnt been much help, but good luck with it all.  lts a god awful rocky road...but the time does pass.  And now l'm almost about to ring the big bell at my final Chemo..cant believe 6 months has passed ! Another tick in the box, then it'll be surgery in Jan l suppose.  Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Preparing for chemo

Posts.Content: Yeh Dreamthief  George. Dont be coming on our 'patch'  forcing Cabbages on us...Life's hard enough at the mo !  lol (impressive design mind )
Posts.Title: Anyone for Cabbage (Radiation related)

Posts.Content: Hi ejm1.  No, l'm the complete opposite to you.   lve travelled soo much always  on my own last 16 yrs (split up with husband 2000)  India, Thailand, Istanbul, auschwitz Ireland, the med etc etc   So Ireland on my own (and Isle Skye for Xmas) is a breeze.  l'm soo independent, would always stay in nice hotels (never with family/friends...would feel hemmed in !)   Mind you, my Oncologist rang me last night to say they've spotted something on my MRI Scan on my lower jaw !!  (and l thought the mri scan was only doing lower back downwards (as ld had  groin/legs muscle spasms)  So got to have another MRI...grhhhh.   Heaven help me if l get to go anywhere !!  3/4 Taxotere on Thursday...just to cheer m up...not !
Posts.Title: Can l fly Liverpool - Dublin after all Chemo's have finished ?

Posts.Content: Dunno Lakeslover...Could be better that an ' OLD  GOAT'   !!!   (had to google meaning  to check.......and it's spot on !)  lol
Posts.Title: Anyone for Cabbage (Radiation related)

Posts.Content: l've been sooo good re my treatment since day 1.  Now l can see a light at the end of the Chemo tunnel (27th Oct)  And  l've got som time early Nov when l would love to go to Dublin  (well, Clonakilty!)  for a few days to treat myself.  lts obviously not a high altitude long haul flight, so please can someone tell me, this should be ok to do.   l would follow any advise...flight socks/ walking up and down  the isle/ exercises in the seat...anything !    After the chemo's have finished, l will absolutely love to know l can get away for a v short break.  Spending soo many hours/days/months stuck mostly in the house (just lil me!)  l'm bursting at the seams to beee freee !!!   And then l'll have surgery to welcome me into the new year !  grhh   lol
Posts.Title: Can l fly Liverpool - Dublin after all Chemo's have finished ?

Posts.Content: Hi Lacomtekpe,  Glad you had a nice time. Sounds lovely.   l've been going to Llangollen for couple nights evry month right thro my Chemo's, and l generally spend the daytime a mix of spending quite a bit of tim in my room (tv/laptop/resting)  then l potter round the lil shops for a browse, then back to the hotel for a coffee/chat with residents maybe. Then l feel fueled a bit to go out  in th evning and have a beer here and there, and stop if l find some live music.  And that's how l intend to b in Ireland.  Plus with a 35 min flight at low altitude (and ld def wear a mask/scarf)  Plus some antibiotics from my GP....l thought l could go for that ??  3 - 10th Nov is the only dates l can go xx
Posts.Title: Can l fly Liverpool - Dublin after all Chemo's have finished ?

Posts.Content: Hi ejm1,  Thnx for your reply.  Did you ask, who would l go with ?  Or did you mean something else ?  Hugs to everyone xx
Posts.Title: Can l fly Liverpool - Dublin after all Chemo's have finished ?

Posts.Content: Since my Chemo's taken hold, my face has gone drier and drier !   l am looking for a v good thin moisturiser.  At the brilliant Maggie's Centre, l attended the Make Up class, and came away with a huge bag of free samples...one of which was Body Shop 'Oil Of Life'  (sleeping cream)  It was fab. Glided on like silk.  Thought l'd go to Body Shop and see what they have.  Just thought l'd ask you lovely ladies for your recommendations.  l dont want a moisturiser that sits on my face or is in any way sticky....Oh, and l want it to make me look 10 yrs younger !  Hugs xx  Hope its ok to ask this non bc question x
Posts.Title: Looking for a good light (thin) Moisturiser ?

Posts.Content: Hi MMouse.  l'm not able to go into town and visit different shops....l can barely walk !  That's why l thought l'd askon here so l could maybe order something online..until l can gather normality and gt myself into Chester. Thnx
Posts.Title: Looking for a good light (thin) Moisturiser ?

Posts.Content: Thnx PSquirrel,  l've just asked EA fro a pos lil sample to be posted.  Love your logo line...where is that from ?  Hugs, xx
Posts.Title: Looking for a good light (thin) Moisturiser ?

Posts.Content: l have never used moisturiser or hand cream ever before a month ago.....so th lil Body Shop sample 'Oil Of Life' was the first moisturiser i've ever used.  Only since the Chemo's has my face felt dry, and felt l needed to start using something.  Praps l should start before l'm 60 !
Posts.Title: Looking for a good light (thin) Moisturiser ?

Posts.Content: All thro my treatment thus far,  l've wanted soo much to know if its anywhere else.  Yesterday, l had an MRI Scan, and they said it was clear (at this stage)   Does anyone know, is this the best scan l can hope for ?    ps, if lm asking too many questions/posts, please say, and slap me down !  lol     xx
Posts.Title: Is An MRI Scan The Best Scan To check If The B.C. Has Spread ?

Posts.Content: Crystaljuju ..  Hi Julia,   Really appreciate your informative reply (as you always do x)l havnt done a profile thing for here, because l know so little. (or rather, remember soo little, as l dont really have it in writing.   Only that its Grade 3. Oestrogen fuelled (my word !)    There is evidence of cancer in lymph nodes  .    its in a tricky position, hence need for Chemo first.   Yes, the MRI Scan was because of the lower back / groins /  legs.   lm pretty sure the scan covered back / groins / legs, because they mentions it.   l imagine, whilst it might  be clear now,  it might come back  later...but good news for now.   Wonder why they didnt scan my breasts and underarms ?   (l would have paid def for that. )    PS, As for the cake and new kitchen, documentary  evidence is essential !  vanillacph@gmail.com   xx
Posts.Title: Is An MRI Scan The Best Scan To check If The B.C. Has Spread ?

Posts.Content: Hi Flopsy,  We seem to have similar stuff.  The Specialist on Thurs said re the links from bc to spine, hence he wanted an MRI Scan.  My bc care is fantastic !  Bravo to our NHS !!!   l'm half way thro my 6 month Chemo's (start the dreaded Taxo 25th)  then surgery. Are you the same.  xx
Posts.Title: Is An MRI Scan The Best Scan To check If The B.C. Has Spread ?

Posts.Content: l'm wondering what l'm supposed to ask my Chemo Consultant tomorrow morning.  Even though l'm halfway thro (done 4 x EC...got 4 x Taxotere start next week)  l still feel quite a newby in the grand scheme of this whirlwind l've caught myself up in !     Praps the appointment is there for me to listen ?   (Fantastic service from day 1,  from all bc depts....so l have no worries)
Posts.Title: Appointment With Chemo Consultant Halfway Thro My Chemo's ??
